name: Horimon 007 唐獅子;FU DOG
description:
Meaning : Protection, Strength, Courageous 
Karashishi, also known as lion dog or Fu dog, has a very long history. It is not a dog but a lion (獅子shi-shi means lion), which was a protector of Buddha. Originating in India, it came to China and Japan, and changed shape to it's current design with colourful curly hair and dot patterns. Karashishi has a strong power and eats your bad luck. However it holds bugs in it's fur which may eat Karashishi's body and kill it. But water drops from peonies can kill these bugs, so Karashishi always sleeps under the peony flowers. There are not many motief rules with tattoos, but when you get a Karashishi tattoo, usually you get peony flowers too so they can protect Karashishi. It's called Karashishi-Botan (Fu Dog and Peony)
